alert.note: Alert for Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 11:15PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN CRAWFORD...SOUTHERN WASHINGTON...NORTHERN SEQUOYAH...ADAIR AND SOUTHEASTERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES THROUGH 1145 PM CST... At 1115 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles southwest of Cookson to 2 miles east of Stilwell. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Stilwell... Natural Dam... West Fork... Lincoln... Westville... Adair State Park... Christie... Blackburn... Maryetta... Cookson... Lee Creek... Cherokee Landing State Park... Bunch... Baron... Eldon... Proctor... Devils Den State Park... Brentwood... Strickler... Woolsey... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 39 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
